New Records: Jason Holder recorded career-best T20 figures of 4 for 7 in the match
Key Match Events: England collapsed to 49 for 7 and were bowled out for 103, their lowest T20I score since 2012
West Indies raced to 50 runs inside nine overs with Brandon King and Shai Hope in the middle
Chris Jordan and Adil Rashid added 36 runs off 29 balls to move England past their lowest T20I total
Jason Holder picked off Saqib Mahmood with a slower ball and bowled Rashid to finish with 4 for 7
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies were in poor form with just nine wins in 26 T20Is since 2021, while England were the No.1 ranked side
England's top-order collapsed quickly with Jason Roy, Tom Banton, and Moeen Ali all dismissed cheaply
Post-Match Reflections: The win was a confidence-boosting success for West Indies despite their recent poor form
Holder's performance was pivotal in the victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article includes a link to the scorecard of the match
This was the first T20I of the series
